intro: Psammisia ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapting well to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in high-altitude areas, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
